title: Hokkien char mee

ingredients.name: low sodium chicken stock or pork stock

recipeInstructions: Cut pork belly in half lengthwise, separating lean from fatty part.
Slice lean pork belly into ⅛-inch slices (about 6 ounces).
Trim skin from fatty pork belly, then slice into ¼-inch pieces and halve.
In cast iron pan, cook fatty pork with salt and ½ cup water until fat renders.
Simmer on low for 15 mins until golden and crisp. Set aside on paper towel.
Rinse shrimp; velvet if desired. Combine oyster sauce, sesame oil, pepper, soy sauces, and stock. Set aside.
Heat wok, add 2 tsp pork lard. Sear pork belly, remove. Add 2 tsp lard, cook shrimp, set aside.
Add 1 tbsp lard, garlic, cabbage. Stir-fry, add Shaoxing wine. Add noodles, toss.
Pour in sauce, stir-fry until simmering. Add pork belly and shrimp, stir to combine.
Stir in half of cornstarch mixture. Adjust thickness with more slurry or water if needed.
Transfer to serving dish, sprinkle pork cracklings on top, and serve!
content:
福建炒面：马来西亚的美味佳肴
================================

福建炒面不仅仅是一道面食，更是浓郁风味和令人满意的口感的盛宴。这道菜源自马来西亚，将五花肉和虾的丰盛美味与复杂的酱汁和调味料混合在一起。

### 风味融合

这道菜脱颖而出，因为它使用了**福建面条**和**绍兴酒**，这增加了风味的深度。酥脆的五花肉增加了令人愉悦的酥脆感，而虾带来了一丝甜味。酱油和蚝油的混合创造了一种难以抗拒的美味鲜味。

### 烹饪技巧

**质地很重要**：确保五花肉 _酥脆_ 。这不仅增加了质感，还增强了菜肴的整体口感。

**调整厚度**：玉米淀粉混合物有助于调整酱汁的厚度。确保逐渐添加以达到完美的稠度。

![](https://www.singaporeanmalaysianrecipes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/kl-hokkien-mee-sauce.jpg)

### 食用建议

趁热食用这道菜，配上酥脆的猪肉脆皮，增添一层风味。非常适合家庭聚餐或与朋友聚会。

![](https://themuddledpantry.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/img_5328.jpg?w=620)

title: Bak kut teh
recipeInstructions: Coarsely grind black and white peppercorns. Combine with star anise and cinnamon, tie tightly, and set aside.
Boil pork ribs and belly in water. After 10 minutes, strain and wash off any impurities.
Return pork to pot with 2 ½ liters water, simmer for 10 minutes, and skim off foam.
Add tied spices and garlic, simmer covered for 30 minutes. Stir in mushrooms and tofu puffs, simmer covered for 30-45 minutes until pork is tender.
Add soy sauce and fish sauce to taste. Divide into 4 bowls. Serve hakken style with rice and chili soy sauce.
For chili soy sauce, pour light soy sauce into 4 bowls and add finely chopped red chilies to taste.
content:
肉骨茶：終極舒適湯
==================================

肉骨茶，通常被稱為“肉骨茶”，是一種溫暖心靈的湯，是馬來西亞和新加坡美食的主食。它的名字可能暗示著一道簡單的菜，但味道卻絕非如此！

### 濃鬱芳香

這道菜以其**複雜的香氣**和**濃鬱的味道**而聞名，這要歸功於白胡椒和黑胡椒、八角茴香和肉桂的混合。長時間的燉煮過程為豬肉注入了濃鬱的鹹味，讓每一匙都令人心曠神怡。

### 完美搭配

肉骨茶最好搭配 _米_ 和一碗 _辣椒醬_ 享用。嫩豬肉和辣醬的結合創造了一頓豐盛又美味的令人滿意的飯菜。

![](https://www.tastingtable.com/img/gallery/bak-kut-teh-recipe-pork-rib-soup/bak-kut-teh-pork-rib-soup-recipe-1640882207.jpg)

### 烹飪技巧

**過濾乾淨**：煮豬肉後，一定要過濾並洗掉雜質，以保持肉湯清澈可口。

**慢慢地煮**：讓湯慢慢地煮，以達到肉的完美嫩度。

title: Hailam kue png
recipeInstructions: Wash chicken, set aside chicken fat. Pat dry, rub with salt, and set aside.
Boil water with ginger and scallions. Rinse chicken, lower into boiling water breast-side up. Adjust water level to cover chicken breast.
After boiling, lift chicken to pour out trapped water. Lower chicken back, bring to boil, cover, turn off heat, and leave covered for 45-50 mins.

Prepare ice bath. After cooking, lift chicken, drain cavity, lower into ice bath for 15 mins. Drain, cover with plastic until ready to serve. Ice bath stops cooking, locks in juices, and improves skin texture.
While chicken cools, make rice. Heat wok, add chicken fat, render for 1 min. Stir in minced garlic, fry briefly.
Add uncooked rice, stir continuously for 2 mins.
Turn off heat. Scoop rice into rice cooker, add chicken stock and salt. Close lid, press START.
Without rice cooker, soak rice for 20 mins, drain, and follow same steps in a pot with 3 cups chicken stock and salt. Simmer covered for 10-15 mins.
While rice cooks, prepare dipping sauces. Grind ginger and garlic in a food processor. Heat oil, fry ginger and garlic until aromatic. Add salt, transfer to sauce dish.
content:
Hailam Kue Png: Singapore’s Bo Beh Zao Chicken Rice
==============================

Hainanese Chicken Rice is more than dish-dish lah, it’s like Singapore’s pride lor. This simple but shiok dish shows how boleh turn basic ingredients into something that makes people go, "Wah, sibe jiak ho!"

### The Essence of Simplicity

Without **juicy chicken** buay do the dish. Poach until tender-tender, you almost want to hug it. Chill in peng bath after masak, so skin can become smooth and slippery, like magic! Masak rice with chicken fat and garlic, soak up all delicious chicken stock. See, meiyou effort, but taste damn ho say ah.

### Pro Tips from Zai Lang for Perfect Chicken Rice

**Peng Bath**: Don’t anyhow skip it lah. This step sibe important to make chicken skin firm and smooth.

**Rice Flavour**: Use chicken fat to char garlic before putting in rice. This step makes the rice sibe _fragrant_ and gives you that no geh geh Hainan taste.

![](https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod/images/how-to-shred-chicken-index-6578adf942609.jpeg?crop=0.9998626562285401xw:1xh;center,top)

### Serving

Wa suka serve with a side of chili sauce and soy sauce, and tak boleh sotong to add fresh cucumbers for that extra crunch. If you tak jiak kantang, makan with your favourite sambal. It’s the full Singapore experience lah!

![](https://twosleevers.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/hainan-chicken-500x500.jpg)

title: Ke bah png
recipeInstructions: Rub turkey with ¼ teaspoon each of salt and white pepper.

In a large pot with a lid and a steamer rack, add 2 cups water. Place the turkey on a dish on top of the steamer rack. Avoid placing directly on a rack with holes to save drippings. Bring to a boil, then simmer and cover. Steam turkey until internal temperature near the bone reaches 180°F, about 30 minutes. Let cool and reserve the juices.
Cool turkey, pull meat into bite-size shreds, and discard bones and skin.
Heat vegetable oil in a pot. Add sliced shallots and cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and reserve the cooking oil.

Combine shallot cooking oil with ½ cup reserved turkey juices. Add water, sugar, soy sauce, Sichuan peppercorns, and ¼ teaspoon each of salt and white pepper. Add half of the fried shallots, saving the rest for garnish. Whisk over medium heat to dissolve sugar. Bring to a gentle boil and simmer, uncovered until sauce is reduced by half, about 30 minutes. Strain sauce and discard solids.
To serve, scoop rice into bowls and top with shredded turkey. Spoon sauce over each bowl. Finish with fried shallots and cilantro for garnish.
content:
嘉義火雞肉飯：美味的火雞軟糖
==============================

嘉義火雞肉飯是台灣一道足受歡迎的菜色。美味的醬汁佮鮮嫩的火雞，這項菜是腥臊閣予人滿意，非常適合任何餐點。

### 每一喙攏是美味的火雞

**火雞仔**炊了足好的，確實保其濟汁釉。用蔥仔佮花椒做的醬汁做這味菜增加了予人歡喜的味。頂懸的糋青蔥仔口感酥，佮幼肉相甲益彰。

### 煮食祕訣

**燃技術**：使用蒸煮架仔避免和水直接觸，保留火雞的氣味佮果汁。

**醬汁減少**：將醬汁煮至減少一半以濃縮味。

![](https://static01.nyt.com/images/2014/10/14/dining/steamturkey-still/steamturkey-still-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg)

### 服務建議

將切碎的火雞肉囥佇咧炊米飯頂懸，淋著濃鬱的醬汁。用糋蔥仔佮鮮芳菜妝娗，增加 _額外_ 的風味。

![](https://attach.setn.com/newsimages/2020/09/07/2760300-PH.jpg)

title: Bakpia
recipeInstructions: Soak mung beans in water for 1 hour, then steam them.
Blend steamed mung beans with 1 tbsp sugar and salt to make small balls.
Mix yeast, 1 tbsp sugar, and 5 tbsp warm water in a glass until bubbly (5-7 minutes).
Let small dough rest for 30 minutes, covered with a clean towel.
Roll out the dough on an oiled surface.
Fill dough with mung beans or chocolate.
Shape into balls and press them.
Brush a pan with butter or vegetable oil, then heat it.
Bake filled dough for 5 minutes on each side.
content:
Bakpia: A Sweet Indonesian Treat
==============================

Bakpia, or mung bean pastry, is a popular snack in Indonesia. These sweet treats are perfect for an afternoon snack or as a delightful gift.

### Sweet and Savoury

The **mung bean filling** is sweetened and encased in a soft pastry dough, creating a delicious contrast of flavours. The baking process gives the pastries a golden-brown exterior and a soft, chewy interior.

### Baking Tips

**Dough Consistency**: Ensure the dough is soft and pliable for easy rolling and shaping.

**Filling**: You can also experiment with different fillings like chocolate for a twist on the traditional recipe.

![](https://img-global.cpcdn.com/recipes/3251cce09dedd0db/1200x630cq70/photo.jpg)

### Serving Suggestions

Enjoy these pastries _warm_ or at _room_ temperature. They make a perfect accompaniment to tea or coffee and are great for sharing with friends and family.

![](https://bobobox.com/blog/wp-content//uploads/2023/06/Rekomendasi-10-Bakpia-Terenak-di-Jogja.jpg)

title: Tikoy
recipeInstructions: Boil water in a steamer pot. Place a steamer basket over it.
Brush a round pan with oil. Mix sugar and water until dissolved.
In a large bowl, mix glutinous rice flour with water until smooth.
Pour batter into the oiled pan. Steam for 50-60 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool, loosen edges with a knife, and invert on a surface lined with plastic film.
Wrap in plastic film and refrigerate for 4 hours to overnight.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pan. Slice tikoy into ¼ inch pieces.
Beat eggs in a bowl. Dip slices in beaten eggs.
Fry slices in the pan for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy outside, soft inside.
content:
Tikoy: A Sweet Filipino Delight
==============================

Tikoy, also known as *Nian Gao*, is a beloved Filipino treat made from glutinous rice flour. This sweet, chewy delicacy is perfect for special occasions and a delightful snack.

### A Traditional Favourite

Tikoy is known for its **chewy texture** and _subtly_ sweet flavour. It's often enjoyed during Lunar New Year celebrations, symbolising good luck and prosperity. The process of steaming and then frying gives Tikoy its distinctive texture—crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

### Cooking Tips

**Steaming Perfectly**: Ensure that the batter is smooth and well-mixed before pouring it into the pan. Steaming for the full time ensures that the Tikoy sets properly.

**Frying to Perfection**: When frying, keep the heat medium to ensure the slices get crispy without burning.

![](https://pingdesserts.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/tikoy-00.jpg)

### Serving Suggestions

After chilling, slice the Tikoy into pieces and dip them in beaten eggs before frying. Serve these delicious slices as a snack or dessert. They pair wonderfully with tea or coffee.

![](https://pingdesserts.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/tikoy-04.jpg)

### Enjoy the Sweetness

Tikoy is not only a treat for the taste buds but also a part of Filipino cultural heritage. Whether you're making it for a special occasion or just for a tasty snack, this recipe is sure to bring joy to your table.

![](https://www.kawalingpinoy.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/homemade-tikoy-3-480x270.jpg)
